column4: trying to install alfresco in ubuntu hardy server and need sun-java6-jdk. I am not able to install the jdk package. Why not?
enable multiverse repository and then sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk
thanks, thought I had uncommentet the multiverse repo - but I hadn't
:-) now its working?
Yes
can I copy a blueray disk as well
not directly because of copy protection
if you mean a movie
is it possible to rip a blueray then?
yes
with a normal dvd-player and say, acidrip?
no, never saw a dvd-player which can read blu-ray
yes
what about using real questions instead of "anyone"?
I need to find a substitute for MS Sharepoint - haven't much knowledge about MS sharepoint - but have ordered a book on it - I want to find a good alternative in open source
but I don't know if alfresco is anything like sharepoint
not really like sharepoint
there is a openoffice-plugin for alfrescxo for using something like sharepint but the plugin is out of date and not working anymore
ok do you know about anything in open source doing tha same or almost the same as sharepoint?
sorry dont know, maybe its a bad answer but tried google?
that's how I found alfresco - I've left a question on a debian-edu.list - I may get some answers there
alfresco is ok but nothing on sharepoint (imo)
are you sure the OO-plugin doesn't work - google seems to give me alfresco as the only alternative to sharepoint
when i was testing it with oo 3.x it was not working, just with oo 2.4 (2 months ago)
